body: Hi guys, I would like to know how it would be possible to set the -g and -ac parameters in order to calculate a scene with accelerad_rtrace. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pEYWotxu2NIkRQTrP80Mqvg7PlT71rQml67YyBv7Ylqeqni9ZHuQK7dPx1FDBO-dlutRBuI2meAZSfM5JJNz0Su9pn9fg28V/RadParameters.JPG) As you can see, the additionalIP_ doesn't seem to take into account custom parameters but functions perfectly for -lw and -lr. I have noticed this piece of code in honeybee_honeybee component: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pEYWotxu2NITh09cmx55Qo-6J3eARzcwfgTZgfjvgYkTtuD1htwu6zGGAkePDxS-w3l9V2dbbR1CErCMqEkTX0RWiXfuAwf9/RadParameters_honeybee.JPG) But when I add "_g_" and "_ac_" to the self.additionalRadPars list, it still can't set the values that I want, leaving it to blank and causing the simulation to crash. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pEYWotxu2NJYbosSNKPZyey-SnRRr5HBcI0LSCaDlzuI9c0A8oEqpKh7sZD1b7IDVE3IyRnpz8SWm*AmEQh8jBxnuUTTFrYB/RadParameters_honeybee2.JPG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pEYWotxu2NJGd460AayIaReUHDiu60jQ1BKSzSUguV-fhU5lnqXJDqo2xwuHzpMPnUTLzG-LaxEvsCqnITK1S*V5boFoexU3/RadParameters_honeybee3.JPG) I'm probably missing something... but I don't know what. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Regards, Aymeric
